title: Pls answer..
content: Does doing well in backlog exams improve our cgpa??

comments.body: Yes pls someone pls answer i too want to know seniors pls

Bruh my math went so bad i dont even want to talk about it and getting the same feeling for phy too... I feel so hopeless about my cgpa. its really demotivating to study other subjects too whn your prev subjects dont go well i just feel so hopeless want someone to actually pull me out of this plsss
Someone had mentioned that getting as S in backlog exam is equivalent to getting an E in a regular exam
Na it's equivalent to getting C afaik

It will. A backlog means you have an F grade, which corresponds to a 4 point. When you clear a backlog, that grade improves and thus the credit point associated with it also. 

Note - as far as I know, you cannot score higher than a C grade in a backlog exam. So the 4 point can only increase to a 7 point at most.

you wont know how bad it went until you get your results, most subjects might have relative grading and u would get better than how much you expecting so dont think ab it and study well for your next exam else you will regret not giving your everything.
Dude do uk how backlog exams gonna be gradded ?? if yes pls ansðŸ¤§
